page.title: 07ST ANDREWS CHURCH,INTERIOR
page.content: The De Vere Family,the Earls of Oxford ,built the Church from a priory in the eleventh century.There are two pillars left of the original fabric.The present vicar is Canon Stuart Holden. There are 60 pews with carved bench end,these were given to the Church by Ruben and Elizabeth Hunt.The lecturn is unusual because it is a WOODEN eagle,most are brass.The octagonal wooden pulpit has carved and painted panels.The font stands between the tower and porch.The stone is a elaborately carved,it has a wooden lid and a plug in the bottom.The font leaks when it's emptied.The choir stalls are made of dark oak and have kings,Queens,Foxes and wolves carved on them.The alter is a simple rectangular table covered by a cloth.On it stand two silver candlesticks and a crystal cross.
